alert.note: Alert for Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Scotland and southeastern Richmond Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 744 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Chavistown, or 8 miles north of Bennettsville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Hamlet, Hoffman, Dobbins Heights, Gibson, East Laurinburg, East Rockingham, Laurel Hill and Sandhills Game Land. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
